intro: Bienertia cycloptera, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in sandy and gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. It is well adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. The plant is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in desert landscapes.
